thread.title: Adelaide Crows to honour murdered coach Phil Walsh against West Coast at Subiaco |
thread.title_full: Adelaide Crows to honour murdered coach Phil Walsh against West Coast at Subiaco | The Advertiser

author: Alex White, Gilbert Gardiner
title: Adelaide Crows to honour murdered coach Phil Walsh against West Coast at Subiaco |
text:
PLAYERS, fans and coaches have paid tribute to murdered Adelaide coach Phil Walsh before the Crows returned to the field for the first time since the tragedy.
Crows and West Coast Eagles players, umpires, coaches and fans stood arm in arm for a minute’s silence before the start of the game in Perth.
LIVE MATCH COVERAGE: Eagles host Crows at Subiaco
ROBBO: How will Adelaide react?
Crows players pay respect to coach Phil Walsh. Picture: Paul Kane, Getty Images Source: Getty Images
Tributes have continued into the play, with Adelaide player Eddie Betts kissing his bland arm band after kicking a goal in the opening term. Other Crows players looked up to the sky after scoring.
The Eagles fired early, scoring the first two goals. But the Crows rallied to lead by 14 points at quarter time.
Players, umpires and coaches unite. Source: News Corp Australia
A memorial service for Phil Walsh will be held next week. Picture: Getty Source: Getty Images
Tonight is the Crows players’ first chance to publicly honour their coach as a group.
Before the game, television commentators described the mood at Domain Stadium as “eerie”.
The emotion-charged Round 15 clash is the Crows’ first game without Walsh, 55, who was stabbed to death in his Adelaide home last Friday week.
The club’s Round 14 fixture against Geelong was cancelled.
Crows players huddle before the first bounce. Picture: Paul Kane, Getty Images Source: Getty Images
The players unite to honour Walsh. Source: Getty Images
Walsh’s name was shown on the field and before kick-off tributes began to flow on social media. Kaye Bishop tweeted: “Thoughts to the Adelaide Crows as tonight will be a tough game, their first since the death of Phil Walsh.”
Fellow fan John Cahill said: “A fiercely committed effort would reinforce the belief Phil Walsh had in the team.”
Other supporters urged Crow fans to wear scarves in memory of the popular coach.
Meagan Hayes and mum Denise Hayes comfort each other at Domain Stadium. Picture: Mark Brake Source: News Corp Australia
Following the tribute, West Coast coach Adam Simpson said it was a tragic event but hoped his team would channel their emotion into their game.
“As sad as it is, we have got a game to play and we are going to be ruthless,” he said.
Crows players take to the field. Picture: Mark Brake Source: News Corp Australia
Taylor Walker hugs Josh Jenkins after a goal. Picture: Colleen Petch. Source: News Corp Australia
Fans carried banners and heavy hearts as they arrived at Domain stadium for tonight’s clash.
Emotional Adelaide fans Meagan and Denise Hayes couldn’t hold back a tear as they remembered the slain coach.
Crows interim coach Scott Camporeale during the warm-up this afternoon. Picture: Colleen Petch Source: News Corp Australia
Scott Camporeale, named interim coach of the Crows during the week, watched his charges closely as they went through their paces at warm-up this afternoon.
Port Adelaide paid tribute to Walsh, a former Power assistant coach, on Thursday night with a lantern-lit vigil at Adelaide Oval.
Power players and coach Ken Hinkley were visibly emotional after their thrilling three-point win over Collingwood.
Travis Boak and Ollie Wines after the match. Picture: Sam Wundke Source: News Corp Australia
The sound and light show punctuated a series of AFL tributes which started with Hawthorn and Collingwood players locking arms in the centre of the MCG last Friday week.
Collingwood and Hawthorn players remember Phil Walsh. Picture: Michael Klein Source: News Corp Australia
A private funeral service was held for Walsh yesterday with a memorial to be held at Adelaide Oval on Wednesday ahead of next Sunday’s Showdown against Port Adelaide.
Walsh’s son, Cy, 26, held by police in a mental health facility in Adelaide, is charged with his father’s murder.
No application for bail was made on his behalf with the matter to return to court in September.
The Crows have not played since their Round 13 win over Brisbane at the Gabba.
Originally published as Crows, Eagles pay tribute to Walshy
